intro: Tephroseris taitoensis, commonly known as the Taitoensis Tephroseris, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces showy, fragrant blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
